parameters.V10: volatility of crude; ASTM 10% point. (Constant within sample.)
parameters.Y: yield as a percentage of crude.
parameters.SG: specific gravity, degrees API.  (Constant within sample.)
parameters.EP: desired volatility of gasoline. (The end point.  Varies within sample.)
parameters.VP: vapour pressure in pounds per square inch. (Constant within sample.)

reference:
N. H. Prater (1956) Estimate gasoline yields from
crudes. Petroleum Refiner 35, 236–238.
description:
Description
The yield of a petroleum refining process with four covariates.
The crude oil appears to come from only 10 distinct samples.
These data were originally used by Prater (1956) to
build an estimation equation for the yield of the refining
process of crude oil to gasoline.
title: N. L. Prater's Petrol Refinery Data
